courses.name: Introduction to Programming
courses.description: Fundamentals of programming using Python. Covers basic syntax, control structures, functions, and simple data structures.

courses.name: Object-Oriented Programming
courses.description: Introduction to object-oriented programming concepts using Java. Covers classes, objects, inheritance, polymorphism, and encapsulation.

courses.name: Data Structures and Algorithms
courses.description: Study of fundamental data structures and algorithms. Includes arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, graphs, sorting, and searching algorithms.

courses.name: Computer Organization
courses.description: Introduction to computer organization and architecture. Covers digital logic, processor design, memory systems, and I/O organization.

courses.name: Database Management Systems
courses.description: Introduction to database systems. Covers relational database design, SQL, normalization, transaction processing, and concurrency control.

courses.name: Operating Systems
courses.description: Study of operating system concepts including processes, threads, CPU scheduling, memory management, file systems, and security.

courses.name: Software Engineering
courses.description: Principles of software engineering including requirements analysis, design, implementation, testing, and project management.

courses.name: Computer Networks
courses.description: Introduction to computer networks including network architectures, protocols, routing, switching, and network security.

courses.name: Artificial Intelligence
courses.description: Introduction to artificial intelligence including search algorithms, knowledge representation, machine learning, and natural language processing.

courses.name: Circuit Analysis
courses.description: Fundamentals of electrical circuit analysis including DC and AC circuits, network theorems, and transient analysis.

courses.name: Digital Logic Design
courses.description: Introduction to digital logic circuits including Boolean algebra, combinational and sequential circuits, and digital system design.

courses.name: Electronics I
courses.description: Study of semiconductor devices including diodes, bipolar junction transistors, and field-effect transistors.

courses.name: Signals and Systems
courses.description: Introduction to continuous and discrete-time signals and systems including Fourier analysis and system response.

courses.name: Power Systems
courses.description: Study of power generation, transmission, and distribution systems including transformers, generators, and protection systems.

courses.name: Calculus I
courses.description: Differential calculus including limits, continuity, derivatives, and applications of derivatives.

courses.name: Calculus II
courses.description: Integral calculus including integration techniques, applications of integration, and infinite series.

courses.name: Physics I: Mechanics
courses.description: Classical mechanics including kinematics, dynamics, energy, momentum, rotational motion, and oscillations.

courses.name: Physics II: Electricity and Magnetism
courses.description: Electricity and magnetism including electrostatics, circuits, magnetic fields, and electromagnetic waves.

courses.name: Introduction to Business
courses.description: Overview of business concepts including management, marketing, finance, accounting, and business ethics.

courses.name: Principles of Microeconomics
courses.description: Introduction to microeconomic principles including supply and demand, market structures, consumer behavior, and firm theory.

courses.name: Introduction to Psychology
courses.description: Overview of psychological concepts including cognition, perception, learning, motivation, and social psychology.

courses.name: Engineering Mechanics: Statics
courses.description: Study of static equilibrium of particles and rigid bodies including forces, moments, and free-body diagrams.

courses.name: Introduction to Civil Engineering
courses.description: Overview of civil engineering disciplines including structural, environmental, geotechnical, and transportation engineering.

courses.name: Introduction to Chemical Engineering
courses.description: Overview of chemical engineering principles including material and energy balances, process calculations, and unit operations.
